meanings.definition: Understood or implied without being stated
meanings.sent1: She tacitly agreed to the plan by nodding her head.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had a tacitly agreement to always cover for each other.
meanings.sent3: The cat tacitly demanded treats by sitting in front of the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds tacitly warned of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His smile tacitly conveyed his gratitude better than any words could.

meanings.definition: Expressed or carried out without words or speech
meanings.sent1: Their tacitly agreement to help each other was evident in their actions.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together tacitly, each knowing their role without needing to be told.
meanings.sent3: The magician tacitly made the coin disappear, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The painting tacitly captured the essence of a bustling city street.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements tacitly expressed the emotions of the music.
